intro: Henningia himalaica, commonly known as the Himalayan henningia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its foliage consists of finely divided leaves, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Henningia himalaica is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
